race.name: Abyssal Courtier
entries: As an Abyssal Courtier you have the following racial traits

entries.name: Ability Score Increase (recommended)
entries: Your Charisma score increases by 2, and your Constitution score increases by 1.

entries.name: Age
entries: Abyssal Courtiers mature at a rate similar to humans but can live up to 500 years, becoming more eerie and graceful as they age.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 20 feet. You have a swimming speed of 40 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to the abyssal depths, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in {@quickref Vision and Light||2||dim light} within 120 feet of you as if it were {@quickref Vision and Light||2||bright light}, and in darkness as if it were {@quickref Vision and Light||2||dim light}. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: You can breathe both air and water.

entries.name: Cold Resistance
entries: You have resistance to cold damage.

entries.name: Tentacle Grasp
entries: You have a tentacle attack that is a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with it, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. You can use your tentacle to try to {@action grapple} creatures.

entries.name: Mystic Elegance
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Persuasion} and {@skill Deception} skills.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common}, {@language Primordial|PHB|Aquan}, and {@language Deep Speech}.

race.name: Crimson Beak
entries: As a Crimson beak you have the following racial traits

entries.name: Ability Score Increase (recommended)
entries: Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Charisma score increases by 1.

entries.name: Age
entries: Crimson Beak mature at 20 and can live up to 150 years.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in {@quickref Vision and Light||2||dim light} within 60 feet of you as if it were {@quickref Vision and Light||2||bright light}, and in darkness as if it were {@quickref Vision and Light||2||dim light}. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Nature's Bond
entries: You can communicate with plants as if you shared a common language, allowing you to glean information about your surroundings or recent events in the area.

entries.name: Floral Curative
entries: You know the secret to crafting a special herbal brew from the magical fruits fostered by your kind. During a short rest, you can create a number of these brews equal to your Intelligence modifier (a minimum of once). A creature can use an action to drink a brew and regain hit points equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Intelligence modifier. Once a brew is consumed, it loses its potency.

entries.name: Forest Guide
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Survival} skill.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common}, {@language Primordial|PHB|Auran}, and {@language Sylvan}.

race.name: Kenshiroku
entries: As a Kenshiroku you have the following racial traits

entries.name: Ability Score Increase (recommended)
entries: Your Dexterity score increases by 2, and your Wisdom score increases by 1.

entries.name: Age
entries: Kenshiroku mature at the same rate as humans but live longer, often around 150 years.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Mystic Awareness
entries: Due to your spiritual discipline, you have proficiency in the {@skill Insight} skill.

entries.name: Natural Agility
entries: You can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than yours.

entries.name: Guardian Training
entries: You have proficiency with the {@item longsword|PHB}, {@item shortsword|PHB}, and {@item shortbow|PHB}.

entries.name: Calm Presence
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

entries.name: Spiritual Insight
entries: Once per long rest, you can enter a meditative state as a bonus action. For 1 minute, you gain advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common} and one other language of your choice (perhaps a secret language known only to your clan).

race.name: Lupercorn
entries: As a Lupercorn you have the following racial traits

entries.name: Ability Score Increase (recommended)
entries: Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Strength score increases by 1.

entries.name: Age
entries: Lupercorns mature at the same rate as humans but live a few centuries.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to the dark corridors of ancient ruins, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in {@quickref Vision and Light||2||dim light} within 60 feet of you as if it were {@quickref Vision and Light||2||bright light}, and in darkness as if it were {@quickref Vision and Light||2||dim light}. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Demonic Heritage
entries: You have resistance to cold and fire damage.

entries.name: Warrior's Instinct
entries: You have advantage on Initiative rolls.

entries.name: Arcane Adept
entries: You are proficient in the {@skill Arcana} skill.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Lance Training
entries: You have proficiency with {@item lance|PHB|lances}.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common}, {@language Abyssal}, and {@language Infernal}.

race.name: Magravis
entries: As a Magravis you have the following racial traits

entries.name: Ability Score Increase (recommended)
entries: Your Dexterity score increases by 2, and your Wisdom score increases by 1.

entries.name: Age
entries: Magravis reach maturity around the age of 20 and can live up to 150 years.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet, and you have a flying speed of 40 feet. To use this speed, you can't be wearing medium or heavy armor.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in {@quickref Vision and Light||2||dim light} within 60 feet of you as if it were {@quickref Vision and Light||2||bright light}, and in darkness as if it were {@quickref Vision and Light||2||dim light}. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Mask of Mystery
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

entries.name: Radiant Plumage
entries: You can use your action to release a burst of radiant energy from your feathers. Each creature within 20 feet of you must make a Dexterity saving throw with a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier. A creature takes radiant damage equal to {@dice 2d6} on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The damage increases to {@dice 3d6} at 6th level, {@dice 4d6} at 11th level, and {@dice 5d6} at 16th level. After you use your Radiant Plumage, you can't use it again until you complete a long rest.

entries.name: Feathered Cloak
entries: You have a +1 bonus to your Armor Class.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common} and {@language Primordial|PHB|Auran}.

race.name: Marinth
entries: As a Marinth you have the following racial traits

entries.name: Ability Score Increase (recommended)
entries: Your Wisdom score increases by 2, and your Intelligence score increases by 1.

entries.name: Age
entries: Marinth age gracefully, living up to 300 years. They reach adulthood at around 30.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet. You have a swimming speed of 40 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to the deep and dark ocean waters, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in {@quickref Vision and Light||2||dim light} within 60 feet of you as if it were {@quickref Vision and Light||2||bright light}, and in darkness as if it were {@quickref Vision and Light||2||dim light}. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: You can breathe both air and water.

entries.name: Cold Immunity
entries: You are immune to cold damage.

entries.name: Marine Telepathy
entries: You can communicate with aquatic creatures within a 60-foot radius as long as they have a language.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries: You know the {@spell Shape Water|XGE} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell Create or Destroy Water} spell once per day.
When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell Control Water} spell once per day. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common} and {@language Primordial|PHB|Aquan}.

race.name: Stoneshield
entries: As a Stoneshield you have the following racial traits

entries.name: Ability Score Increase (recommended)
entries: Your Strength score increases by 2, and your Wisdom score increases by 1.

entries.name: Age
entries: Stoneshields are created with a specific purpose and begin their life as fully mature individuals. They can live for several centuries, their bodies eroding slowly over time.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to the dimly lit corridors of the ancient structures they protect, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in {@quickref Vision and Light||2||dim light} within 60 feet of you as if it were {@quickref Vision and Light||2||bright light}, and in darkness as if it were {@quickref Vision and Light||2||dim light}. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Guardian's Resistance
entries: You have resistance to poison damage, and you are immune to the {@condition poisoned} condition.

entries.name: Ancient Knowledge
entries: Your long existence and connection to ancient places grant you proficiency in the {@skill History} skill.

entries.name: Stone Skin
entries: Your skin is tough like stone. You have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical attacks.

entries.name: Guardian's Aura
entries: As a bonus action, you can emanate a protective aura with a radius of 10 feet, lasting until the start of your next turn. You and your allies within the aura gain a +1 bonus to AC. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common} and {@language Primordial}.

race.name: Zynthriel
entries: As a Zynthriel you have the following racial traits

entries.name: Ability Score Increase (recommended)
entries: Your Charisma score increases by 2, and your Dexterity score increases by 1.

entries.name: Age
entries: Zynthriel mature at a similar rate to elves, reaching adulthood at around 100 years and living up to 750 years.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to twilight forests and the night sky, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in {@quickref Vision and Light||2||dim light} within 60 feet of you as if it were {@quickref Vision and Light||2||bright light}, and in darkness as if it were {@quickref Vision and Light||2||dim light}. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Ethereal Movement
entries: You can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. You take 5 force damage if you end your turn inside an object.

entries.name: Mind Shield
entries: You are immune to being {@condition frightened} and have resistance to psychic damage.

entries.name: Memory Collector
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Insight} skill. As part of a long rest, you can create a psychic link with a willing creature to view its memories from the past 24 hours. You must maintain physical contact with the creature throughout the rest, and it must remain willing throughout the entire duration.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common} and {@language Elvish}.

raceFluff.name: Abyssal Courtier
entries: {@note See the corresponding monster statblock: {@creature Abyssal Courtier|MaM}.}

raceFluff.name: Crimson Beak
entries: {@note See the corresponding monster statblock: {@creature Crimson Beak Enchanter|MaM}.}

raceFluff.name: Zynthriel
entries: {@note See the corresponding monster statblock: {@creature Zynthriel|MaM}.}

item.name: Amulet of the Nightbat
entries: This amulet features a round centerpiece resembling a bat's face with two large eyes from which a gentle stream of smoke perpetually drifts, framed by wings on either side.

This mysterious artifact grants the wearer the ability to see in complete darkness, conferring {@sense darkvision} up to a range of 60 feet. If the wearer already has {@sense darkvision}, wearing the amulet extends the range of their {@sense darkvision} by an additional 15 feet. Moreover, during the night, the wearer has the special ability to transform into a small {@creature bat|MM}, maintaining all their carried items in the transformation, but reducing their size significantly to accommodate their new form. This transformation grants a flight speed of 30 feet but prohibits attacking and casting spells. This bat form lasts for up to 10 minutes, after which the wearer reverts back to their original form.

Furthermore, once per day as an action, the wearer can unleash a cloud of obscuring smoke, {@quickref Vision and Light|PHB|2||heavily obscuring} the area in a 15-foot radius around them for a minute, providing cover and the opportunity to escape or hide. This property resets at dawn.

item.name: Boots of the Harvest Moon
entries: These leather boots are adorned with symbols of crescent moons and shining stars. They allow the user to cast the {@spell Goodberry} spell once per day.
Additionally, on the night of a full moon, the wearer can, as an action, attune themselves to the lunar energy, gaining a +1 bonus to all attack and damage rolls for the duration of this night.
This effect can be used again on the next full moon.

item.name: Cloak of Cosmic Wonders
entries: This cloak bears the depth of a starry night sky, interwoven with sparkling threads that create a tapestry of constellations that move gently as if guided by an invisible hand. The cloak has a dimension almost beyond comprehension, appearing deeper and more vast the more one gazes upon it.

While wearing this cloak, the user gains a +2 bonus to AC and saving throws. The cloak has 3 charges and regains all expended charges daily at dawn. The wearer can use an action to expend a charge and transport themselves and up to five other willing creatures they can see to a random location within 500 miles. The new location is always on solid ground and is not inherently dangerous.

Moreover, once per long rest, the wearer can envelop themselves in the cloak, becoming one with the cosmos and gaining the insights of the stars. For 10 minutes, they gain {@sense truesight} up to a range of 120 feet and a +2 bonus to Intelligence and Wisdom checks.

item.name: Frostbite Axe
entries: This battleaxe carries the cold essence of the polar ice caps, the blade crafted from a rare form of unmelting ice that seems to absorb the surrounding light, giving it a deep blue glow. Its haft is made from frozen hardwood, preserved and strengthened by the cold, providing a sturdy grip that feels cool to the touch.

When you hit with an attack using this magic axe, the target takes an additional {@damage 1d6} cold damage. Moreover, the axe has 3 charges, regaining all expended charges at dawn. As a bonus action, you can expend a charge to release a chilling aura, forcing creatures within a 10-foot radius to make a Constitution saving throw ({@dc 15}) or have their speed halved until the end of their next turn due to frost forming on their limbs.

Furthermore, once per day, as an action, you can summon a wall of ice (as the {@spell Wall of Ice} spell) emanating from the axe, allowing you to shape the battlefield and protect your allies. The wall has a duration of 10 minutes, and you do not need to maintain {@status concentration} on this effect.

item.name: Gauntlets of the Thunderous Applause
entries: These gauntlets are imbued with the power of thunder. Once per turn, as a bonus action, the wearer can clap the gauntlets together to create a sonic shockwave. All creatures within a 15-foot radius must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 2d6} thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

item.name: Goblet of Everflow
entries: This finely crafted goblet fills with the drinker's beverage of choice once per day. When drunk from, the liquid grants the user the benefits of a {@spell Heroes' Feast} spell, which lasts for 24 hours. This feature can only be used once per 30 days.

item.name: Hood of Whispering Shadows
entries: This dark hood melds seamlessly into an ethereal, phantom-like portion that swirls gracefully at the wearer's neck. The hood is adorned with subtly changing designs that appear to move and whisper secrets into the wearer's ear, granting them a unique harmony with the shadows.

While wearing this hood, the wearer gains advantage on {@skill stealth} rolls. Furthermore, the wearer can use an action to become {@condition invisible} until they {@action attack}, {@action cast a spell}, or one hour passes. Once used, this property cannot be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Phoenix Feather Bow
entries: This ethereal bow is crafted from the golden feathers of a phoenix, a legendary bird known for its fiery and rejuvenating powers.

While wielding this bow, every arrow loosed is engulfed in phoenix fire, dealing an additional {@damage 1d6} fire damage upon a hit. This magical flame does not consume the arrow and is extinguished shortly after impact.

Once per day, as an action, the wielder can embody the spirit of the phoenix, transforming themselves into a magnificent firebird. This grants a flying speed of 60 feet and immunity to fire damage for a duration of 10 minutes. During this time, the wielder retains their intelligence and the ability to speak but cannot perform other actions or spells requiring hands or {@status concentration}.

A unique bond forms between the bow and its attuned wielder, offering a final safeguard against death. If the wielder is reduced to 0 hit points, they can choose to activate the bow's ultimate power, rebirthing from ashes with half their maximum hit points restored. This sacrificial act consumes the bow, reducing it to a pile of golden ash and preventing its use henceforth. This rebirth ability can only be used once, signaling the final act of the Phoenix Feather Bow.

item.name: Ring of the Vortex
entries: This ring contains a constantly swirling miniature vortex. As an action, the wearer can unleash the vortex, which pulls objects weighing 50 pounds or less within a 30-foot radius toward the wearer. Once per day, the wearer can choose to enlarge the vortex, attempting to pull creatures within a 30-foot radius towards them; affected creatures must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 15 feet closer to the wearer.

item.name: Scimitar of the Crimson Shard
entries: This scimitar has a dark and ominous presence, with sharp, jagged edges and a blade adorned with crimson details that gleam with a red glow in the darkness. Once per day, as an action, the wielder can activate the scimitar's crimson surge, a power that lasts for 10 minutes. During this time, any creature hit by an attack from this weapon suffers an additional {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage as the red details glow brighter with each strike. This power resets at dawn.
Furthermore, the weapon's cruel, jagged design means that critical hits deal an extra {@damage 1d4} slashing damage, tearing through flesh with ease.
Outside of combat, the crimson inlays can softly illuminate the surroundings, casting a dim red light in a 10-foot radius.

item.name: Siren's Whisper
entries: This delicate pendant is a turquoise seashell that constantly emits a soft, calming sound reminiscent of distant ocean waves. When worn, it harmonizes with the heartbeat of the wearer, instilling a deep connection with the elemental force of the ocean.

Once per day, as a bonus action, the wearer can channel the calming force of the pendant to soothe turbulent waters. For the next 10 minutes, the wearer gains the ability to calm rough waters in a 100-foot radius, turning them into calm waters, making it significantly easier to navigate for boats and ships. This calming effect can also be used to dampen waves and ripples in smaller bodies of water.

item.name: Staff of Verdant Growth
item.reqAttune: by a druid, sorcerer, or wizard
entries: This staff is a living entity, enveloped in vines and crowned with a lush, vibrant green leaf at its tip. It pulses gently with a lifeforce that is synchronized with the heartbeat of the living world.

While holding this staff, the user gains a +1 bonus to their spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of their spells that manipulate plants or control nature. The staff has 5 charges and regains {@dice 1d4 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn.

As an action, the wielder can expend a charge to cast the {@spell Entangle} spell (save {@dc 15}) without using any components. The wielder can also use the staff to cast the {@spell Plant Growth} spell once per day, without expending a spell slot.

Furthermore, the staff grants the wielder a unique communion with plants; plants within a 30-foot radius of the wielder can communicate basic feelings and emotions to them, offering a primal awareness of their surroundings.

item.name: Sword of the Echoing Hills
entries: This finely crafted longsword harbors the spirit of the echoing hills, a place where sound reverberates with power. Once per day, as an action, the wielder can unleash a battle cry that reverberates from the sword, causing enemies within a 30-foot radius to become {@condition stunned} until the end of their next turn unless they succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. This power resets at dawn.

item.name: The Astral Conch of Galerion
entries: This conch shell, as large as a grown man's forearm, is said to have been crafted from one of {@creature Galerion|MaM|Galerion's} shed scales. It has a gleaming, pearlescent finish and its surface is etched with intricate designs that look like constellations. It radiates a powerful, calming energy.

When you blow the conch, it emits a resonant, hauntingly beautiful sound akin to the legendary Astral Song of Galerion. The sound carries clearly for miles and is audible even over loud ambient noise.

entries.name: Calm the Storm:
entries: Once per day, you can blow the conch as an action to calm natural weather conditions within a 5-mile radius. This effect lasts for 1 hour and does not affect magical weather conditions.

entries.name: Astral Aid:
entries: Once per week, while under open skies at night, you can blow the conch as an action to ask Galerion for aid. For the next 10 minutes, you gain the ability to see briefly into the future. You can add a {@dice d10} to one attack roll, saving throw, or ability check. You must decide to use the die before making the roll.

entries.name: Echo of the Cosmos:
entries: Once per month, you can blow the conch as an action to emit Galerion's Astral Song. All creatures within a 1-mile radius must make a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by you for 1 minute. While {@condition charmed} in this way, a creature is awestruck and has a speed of 0. This effect ends for a creature if it takes damage.

entries.name: Note:
entries: The usage of these abilities does not guarantee Galerion's appearance, though it may pique the creature's interest.

This legendary item carries a piece of Galerion's powers and could serve as a powerful tool for adventurers. However, its use should be taken seriously, as Galerion might not take kindly to misuse of its powers.

item.name: Timekeeper's Orb

entries.name: Properties:
entries: The orb possesses a multitude of temporal abilities, allowing its wielder to manipulate the fabric of time to a certain extent. However, its power is highly dependent on the user's understanding and respect for the flow of time. In the wrong hands, reckless use can lead to disastrous consequences, such as time paradoxes or unwelcome attention from the {@creature Timeless Goliath|MaM}.

entries.name: Temporal Stasis (1/Day):
entries: The user can freeze time for everyone but themselves for a few seconds, effectively granting them an additional action during their turn.

entries.name: Aeon's Recall (1/Week):
entries: The user can revert their physical state back to what it was a few minutes ago, effectively undoing any damage or conditions they've suffered within that period.

entries.name: Echoes of Time (1/Month):
entries: The user can glimpse into the potential futures and pasts. This manifests as advantage on three rolls of the user's choice within the next 24 hours.

Using the Orb requires attunement and an understanding of the flow of time. It is said that the {@creature Timeless Goliath|MaM} can sense the use of the Timekeeper's Orb, and may take an interest in the wielder's actions. If the {@creature Timeless Goliath|MaM} deems the user is disrupting the natural order of time, it may intervene to rectify the situation and reclaim the orb.

entries.name: Description:
entries: The Timekeeper's Orb is a rare artifact intricately linked with the {@creature Timeless Goliath|MaM}. This ancient relic appears as a palm-sized sphere, crafted from the same celestial metal as the Goliath's skin, shimmering with ethereal purples and blues that seem to hold a cosmos within. A golden inlay encircles the orb, mirroring the golden ornaments worn by the Goliath. The Timekeeper's Orb is incredibly dense, reflecting its potent connection with time and space.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The Abyssal Courtier can breathe both air and water.

trait.name: Mystic Elegance
entries: Whenever the Abyssal Courtier speaks or uses any form of communication, those who hear its words must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by the Abyssal Courtier for 1 minute. While {@condition charmed} in this way, the creature is inclined to agree with the Courtier's suggestions and requests. This effect ends if the Abyssal Courtier or its allies damage the {@condition charmed} creature. Creatures that successfully save against this effect are immune to the Abyssal Courtier's Mystic Elegance for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Abyssal Courtier makes two claw attacks and one tentacle attack.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the Abyssal Courtier can't use its tentacles on another target.

action.name: Psychic Scream (1/Day)
entries: The Abyssal Courtier emits a psychic wave in a 30-foot radius. All creatures within this area must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 5d8}) psychic damage and be {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Dripping Form
entries: At the start of each of the Aequorin's turns, the ground within 5 feet of it becomes wet and slippery until the end of its next turn. Creatures that enter or start their turn in this area must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or fall {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Water Dependency
entries: The Aequorin requires constant moisture. If it goes without immersing itself in water for 24 hours, it suffers one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

action.name: Water Jet
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d8}) water damage.

action.name: Mystic Glare
entries: The Aequorin targets one creature it can see within 30 feet. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} until the Aequorin's next turn.

trait.name: Aura of Desolation
entries: Creatures within 20 feet of the Aetherdrake must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or become filled with despair, receiving a disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws for 1 minute.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Aetherdrake makes one bite attack and two claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d10 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Ecliptic Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The Aetherdrake exhales a beam of dark energy in a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The Aetherdrake makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Tail Swipe
entries: The Aetherdrake makes a tail attack against one creature within 10 feet. On a hit, the target takes 15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Mystical Roar (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Aetherdrake emits a malevolent roar. Creatures within 30 feet must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} until the end of their next turn.

monster.name: Aquashade
languages: understands Common and Aquan but can't speak

trait.name: Watery Camouflage
entries: Aquashade has the ability to blend seamlessly with its aquatic surroundings. As an action, it can assume the appearance of still water, mirroring its environment. While camouflaged, Aquashade has advantage on {@skill Stealth} checks made to {@action hide} in water or when using water reflections to conceal itself. It remains camouflaged until it takes an action, takes damage, or ends the effect as a bonus action.

action.name: Hydroblast
entries: The Aquashade releases a powerful jet of water in a 60-foot line. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 5d8}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Shadow Strike
entries: {@atk ms}, {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or have its hit point maximum reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest.

bonus.name: Shadowstep
entries: Aquashade can step into the shadows, using them as pathways to maneuver swiftly and unpredictably. Once per turn as a bonus action, Aquashade can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see that is also in dim light or darkness.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Arcanist is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). The Arcanist has the following spells prepared:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Arcanist can cast a spell from its prepared list using the appropriate spell slot.

trait.name: Celestial Affinity
entries: During celestial alignments, the Arcanist's spells gain a +1 bonus to their spell save DC and spell attack rolls.

trait.name: Elemental Mastery
entries: The Arcanist can choose to infuse its spells with elemental energy, changing the damage type of a spell to match one of the following: fire, cold, lightning, or force. The Arcanist can use this ability a number of times equal to its Intelligence modifier (4 times), regaining all expended uses after completing a long rest.

action.name: Staff Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: Azure Hornbeast
languages: understands Beast Speech but can't speak

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the Hornbeast moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a horn attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Hornbeast makes one horn attack and one tail attack.

action.name: Horn
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

monster.name: Beetlestone Bot
languages: understands the language of its creators but can't speak

trait.name: Disassemble Structure
entries: The Beetlestone Bot analyzes and identifies weaknesses in a stone structure, enabling it to disable or dismantle traps or weakened portions of the structure with ease. It gains advantage on ability checks related to disabling or dismantling stone-based traps or structures.

action.name: Mandible Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Energy Beam
entries: The Beetlebot emits a concentrated beam of energy from its abdomen. It makes a ranged spell attack with a {@hit 4} bonus to hit, with a range of 30 ft. On a hit, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) force damage.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The Blacroack can breathe both air and water.

trait.name: Magic Sense
entries: The Blacroack can detect the presence of magic within 60 feet of it. It can pinpoint the location of any magical source.

trait.name: Leap Attack
entries: If the Blacroack moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a bite attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Blacroack makes two attacks with its powerful legs or one with its bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Powerful Legs
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}).

action.name: Liquify {@recharge 5}
entries: The Blacroack targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature begins to turn into a liquid form, becoming {@condition restrained}. The creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature becomes {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The Blaze Sprite can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: The Blaze Sprite can magically alter its appearance to mimic an ordinary, harmless campfire, lantern, or any other mundane source of light. This ability allows it to remain unnoticed until it reveals its true nature or decides to engage with unsuspecting creatures.

action.name: Fire Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Ember Burst {@recharge 5}
entries: The Blaze Sprite releases a burst of fiery energy in a 10-foot radius. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Ethereal Flame (1/Day)
entries: The Blaze Sprite turns ethereal for up to 1 minute, during which it can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

monster.name: Blue Faefly Pip
languages: understands Sylvan but communicates via chirps

trait.name: Water Affinity
entries: The Blue Faefly Pip can breathe underwater, and it gains a +5 bonus to its {@skill Stealth} rolls while submerged.

trait.name: Emotive Radiance
entries: When a Faefly Pip's hit points are reduced to half or below, its emotional luminescence triggers. Depending on its color:

entries.name: Blue
entries: Their luminescence takes on a shimmering, watery sheen. The blue Faefly Pip gains a +2 bonus to AC until the start of its next turn, representing a mirage-like distortion making it harder to hit.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The Bluquius can breathe both air and water.

trait.name: Menacing Presence
entries: The Bluquius imposes disadvantage on any Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks to discern its intentions.

trait.name: Gem of Distinction
entries: The gem on its belt grants the Bluquius advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Bluquius makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Water Jet {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 30 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be pushed 10 ft. away and knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Amphibious. Amphibious:
entries: The Bluquius Marauder can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Water Mastery
entries: The Bluquius Marauder has advantage on attack rolls and saving throws while in water.

trait.name: Frenzied Assault
entries: When the Bluquius Marauder's hit points are reduced to half or below, it goes into a frenzy. In this state, it gains an additional multiattack during its turn, allowing it to make one more claw or bite attack than usual. This frenzy lasts until the end of the encounter or until the Marauder is healed above half of its maximum hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Bluquius Marauder makes two melee attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Bluquius Shaman is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The Bluquius Shaman can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Water Mastery
entries: The Bluquius Shaman has advantage on attack rolls and saving throws while in water.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Bluquius Shaman makes two melee attacks: one with its staff and one with its claws.

action.name: Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the Bone Lord to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the Bone Lord drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Bonecraft Armor
entries: The Bone Lord's armor grants it resistance to the first three instances of damage it takes each round.

trait.name: Master of the Horde
entries: The Bone Lord can command any undead creature within 60 feet of it that has an Intelligence of 4 or lower. The creature immediately follows its orders, even if it would normally attack the Bone Lord.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Bone Lord makes two attacks with its bone scythe.

action.name: Bone Scythe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 4d8 + 7}) slashing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Summon Skeletons
entries: The Bone Lord summons {@dice 2d6} {@creature Skeleton Warrior|MaBJoV|Skeleton Warriors} in unoccupied spaces within 60 feet. They act immediately after the Bone Lord in initiative and obey its commands.

legendary.name: Bone Strike
entries: The Bone Lord makes a bone scythe attack.

legendary.name: Command Horde (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Bone Lord issues a command to undead creatures within 60 feet. Up to three such creatures can use their reaction to make a melee attack.

legendary.name: Death's Pull (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The Bone Lord swings its scythe in a broad arc. All creatures within a 15-foot cone must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, they are pulled 10 feet toward the Bone Lord and take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) necrotic damage. On a success, they take half damage and are not pulled.

monster.name: Celestial Charmbringer
languages: understands Common and other languages but can't speak them.

trait.name: Wings of Serenity
entries: The Celestial Charmbringer's wings emit a soothing aura. Allied creatures within 30 feet gain advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened} and have resistance to radiant damage.

trait.name: Astral Inspiration
entries: As a bonus action, the Celestial Charmbringer can inspire courage and determination in nearby allies. Allied creatures within 30 feet gain a +5 bonus to their next attack roll or saving throw.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the Charmbringer fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Celestial Touch
entries: The Celestial Charmbringer touches a creature within reach, restoring 28 ({@dice 4d10 + 6}) hit points and removing any diseases or curses affecting the target.

action.name: Luminous Orb
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 11} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 8d6}) radiant damage. The target must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

legendary.name: Radiant Burst
entries: The Charmbringer releases a burst of radiant energy. Each creature within 10 feet of it must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d8 + 4}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Celestial Inspiration (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Charmbringer bestows celestial inspiration on an allied creature within 30 feet. The creature gains advantage on its next attack roll or saving throw.

legendary.name: Astral Veil (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Charmbringer envelops itself in an ethereal aura, gaining resistance to all damage until the start of its next turn.

monster.name: Clockspider Sentinel
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The Clockspider Sentinel can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Multi-Lens Sight
entries: The Clockspider Sentinel has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Anti-Magic Shell
entries: The Clockspider Sentinel has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Clockspider Sentinel makes two leg stab attacks.

action.name: Leg Stab
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Energy Beam
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 3} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) force damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Crimson Beak Enchanter's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Mesmerizing Gaze
entries: The Crimson Beak Enchanter targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the Enchanter, the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} until the start of the Enchanter's next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Darkfern Pouncer makes two thorny tendril attacks.

action.name: Thorny Tendril
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} until the end of the Darkfern Pouncer's next turn.

action.name: Life Drain
entries: When the Darkfern Pouncer hits a creature with its thorny tendril attack, it regains hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

trait.name: Ethereal Glide
entries: The Dewdrop can move gracefully over both water and land surfaces, gliding as if floating on air, without any hindrance to its movement.

trait.name: Empathic Connection
entries: The Dewdrop has an innate connection to the emotions of creatures around it. It can sense strong emotions and intentions, granting it advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks to read the feelings and motivations of others.

action.name: Aquatic Melody
entries: The Dewdrop weaves a soothing melody with its voice, releasing waves of calming energy in a 20-foot radius. Each creature within the area gains {@dice 1d6} + the Dewdrop's Charisma modifier (4) hit points. The Dewdrop can use this action once per encounter.

action.name: Water Manipulation
entries: The Dewdrop can control the water's currents and shape it within a 30-foot radius. It can create whirlpools, push or pull creatures with water currents, or part the waters to allow safe passage. This ability lasts for 1 minute and can be used once per encounter.

variant.name: Dewdrop Familiar

entries.name: Prerequisites
entries: The character must be a spellcaster with access to the {@spell Find Familiar} spell.

As an alternative to the traditional familiars available through the {@spell Find Familiar} spell, the character may choose to bond with an Dewdrop as their familiar. The Dewdrop shares a magical and empathic connection with its chosen master, forming a unique and powerful partnership.

items: The Dewdrop familiar is water-based and can exist in both water and air without needing to breathe while bonded with its master.
They share an empathic link, allowing telepathic communication up to one mile and sensing each other's emotions and well-being.
Once per day, the master can meditate with the Dewdrop for 10 minutes, gaining temporary hit points equal to half Dewdrop current hit points.

monster.name: Dreampouncer
languages: understands Common and Sylvan, but can't speak

trait.name: Ethereal Movement
entries: The Dreampouncer can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Dream Stalker
entries: If the Dreampouncer is within 10 feet of a sleeping creature, it can enter that creature's dreams as a bonus action. While inside the dream, it is {@condition invisible} and intangible in the physical world.

action.name: Spectral Grasp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) psychic damage.

action.name: Dreamweave
entries: The Dreampouncer targets one creature it can see within 30 feet. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be put into a deep slumber, falling {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute. While asleep, the creature experiences vivid dreams. The creature awakens if it takes damage or if another creature uses its action to shake the sleeper awake.

trait.name: Ethereal Hopper
entries: Dreamwhisker can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. It takes 5 feet of movement to move through a space occupied by another creature.

trait.name: Innocent Charm
entries: {@homebrew Dreamwhisker|Fluffletuft} has advantage on Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) checks made to interact with creatures who perceive it as harmless or non-threatening.

trait.name: Enchanting Aura
entries: Dreamwhisker's enchanting presence soothes the hearts of those around it. Creatures within 10 feet of Dreamwhisker have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Sleep Spores
entries: As an action, Dreamwhisker releases a cloud of sleep-inducing spores in a 15-foot cone. Creatures in that area must make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or fall {@condition unconscious|PHB|asleep} for 1 minute. The effect ends if the creature takes damage or another creature uses an action to wake it. Dreamwhisker can use this action once per encounter.

trait.name: Moonstone Radiance
entries: When bathed in moonlight, the Driffalon's AC increases by 1, and it emits a radiant glow, causing any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the Driffalon to be {@condition blinded} until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Driffalon makes one beak attack and two claw attacks.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Aurora Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The Driffalon exhales a blast of radiant energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, taking 42 ({@damage 12d6}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Whirlwind Feathers
entries: The Driffalon rustles its magnificent wings, creating a flurry of radiant feathers in a 20-foot radius centered on itself. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or take 12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage from the feathers and be {@condition blinded} until the start of the Driffalon's next turn.

legendary.name: Tail Sweep
entries: The Driffalon sweeps its tail around. Each creature within 10 ft. must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or take 15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Heavenly Descent (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Driffalon rises into the air and then swiftly descends to a spot it can see within 60 feet, causing a shockwave. Each creature within 20 feet of that spot must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or take 16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

monster.name: Echo Arcane
languages: understands the language of its creators but can't speak

trait.name: Fade Away
entries: As a reaction when targeted by an attack or a harmful spell, the Echo Arcane can temporarily disperse itself, causing the attack or spell to pass harmlessly through it. The Echo becomes immune to damage until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Mimicry
entries: The Echo Arcane can mimic a magical effect it has witnessed during the encounter. This effect can be a {@spell minor illusion}, a cantrip, or a brief elemental burst (e.g., a small flame or gust of wind). It can use this ability once per encounter.

trait.name: Blazing Presence
entries: The intense heat radiating from the Emberclaw Drake makes it difficult for enemies to maintain their focus. Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the Emberclaw Drake must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or have disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Emberclaw Drake makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Breath Weapon {@recharge 5}
entries: The Emberclaw Drake exhales fire in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 31 ({@damage 7d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Faefluxian has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Mind Whisper
entries: The Faefluxian can telepathically communicate with any creature it can see within 60 ft., even if the creature doesn't understand its language.

trait.name: Trickster's Gambit
entries: The Faefluxian can use a Bonus Action to give itself advantage on its next attack roll, ability check, or saving throw.

trait.name: Gem of Foresight
entries: The gem on the Faefluxian's forehead grants it the ability to see 10 seconds into the future. As a reaction, it can avoid one attack or effect that would otherwise hit, making the attack miss or the effect fail. It can use this trait once per short rest.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Faefluxian makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw Attack
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

legendary.name: Arcane Trick
entries: The Faefluxian performs a minor magical trick, such as creating a small illusion or making a trinket float.

legendary.name: Vanish (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Faefluxian turns {@condition invisible} until it attacks or until its {@status concentration} ends.

legendary.name: Mind Warp (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The Faefluxian targets one creature it can see within 30 ft. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be confused (as per the "{@spell Confusion}" spell) until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Floating Ambush
entries: When the Fernimbus surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage from the attack.

trait.name: Forest Camouflage
entries: The Fernimbus has advantage on {@skill Stealth} checks made in forest terrain.

action.name: Thorny Whips
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Vine Whip
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 10 feet toward the Fernimbus.

action.name: Dazzling Light {@recharge 5}
entries: The Fernimbus emits a burst of dazzling light in a 10-foot radius. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Sparkling Fur
entries: Whenever a creature touches the Fluffletuft, they must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d4} lightning damage as small sparks of harmless electricity crackle from the Fluffletuft's fur.

action.name: Breezy Gust
entries: The Fluffletuft releases a gentle gust of wind in a 10-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be pushed 10 feet away from the Fluffletuft and knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the creature is not pushed or knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Aura of Cold
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the Frost Titan takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) cold damage.

trait.name: Icy Ground
entries: The ground in a 20-foot radius around the Frost Titan is considered {@condition difficult terrain||3} due to the rapid formation of ice.

trait.name: Heart of the Tundra
entries: Once reduced to half of its maximum hit points or fewer, the core of the Frost Titan begins to radiate an intense cold, embodying the harshest conditions of the tundra. The ground within a 30-foot radius of the titan becomes a slick icy surface, making it {@condition difficult terrain||3}. Additionally, each creature that starts its turn within this radius must make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or gain a level of {@condition exhaustion} from the intense cold. Creatures immune to cold damage are immune to this {@condition exhaustion} effect. This ability remains active as long as the titan has half its hit points or fewer.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Frost Titan makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 3d10 + 8}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Frost Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The Frost Titan exhales a blast of freezing air in a 40-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Icy Tomb
entries: The Frost Titan chooses a point it can see within 60 feet. A 10-foot-radius, 20-foot-high cylinder of ice forms centered on that point. Each creature in that cylinder must make a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be trapped in the ice, becoming {@condition restrained}. A creature {@condition restrained} by the ice can use an action to make a Strength check against the titan's save DC, breaking free on a success. The ice has AC 15, 30 hit points, vulnerability to fire damage, and is immune to cold damage.

monster.name: Frostclaw Yeti
languages: understands Common but can't speak it

trait.name: Avalanche Step
entries: The Frostclaw Yeti can move through {@quickref difficult terrain||3} created by ice or snow without impediment.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Frostclaw Yeti makes two attacks: one with its claw and one with its chilling roar.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) slashing damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) cold damage.

action.name: Chilling Roar
entries: The Frostclaw Yeti emits a bone-chilling roar. Each creature within 30 feet of the Yeti that can hear it must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Frost Shell
entries: When the Frostsnail takes damage, it retreats into its shell, gaining +2 to its AC until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Horn Thrust
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Frost Shell Defense
entries: When the Frostsnail Alpha takes damage, it retreats into its shell, granting it resistance to all damage except psychic for 1 round. It can't use its Horn Thrust or Icy Breath while using Frost Shell Defense.

trait.name: Icy Aura
entries: At the start of each of the Frostsnail Alpha's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) cold damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Frostsnail Alpha can make two Horn Thrust attacks.

action.name: Horn Thrust
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Icy Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The Frostsnail Alpha exhales a blast of freezing wind in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 27 ({@damage 5d10}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Galerion fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Aerial Purity
entries: Galerion can't be {@condition poisoned} while it's flying.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Galerion can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of Galerion's choice within 120 feet of it and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Aeroblast {@recharge 5}
entries: Galerion exhales a blast of wind in a 90-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw, taking 71 ({@damage 13d10}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: Galerion makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Galerion makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Galerion beats its mighty wings. Each creature within 15 feet of Galerion must succeed on a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw or take 15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. Galerion can then fly up to half its flying speed.

trait.name: Fiery Core
entries: When the Galvafire is reduced to 0 hit points, it explodes in a burst of molten lava. Each creature within 20 ft. of it must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 35 ({@damage 10d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Molten Body
entries: A creature that touches the Galvafire or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 ft. of it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Galvafire makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Molten Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The Galvafire exhales a blast of searing flame in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 56 ({@damage 16d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Shimmering Camouflage
entries: When in dim light or darkness, the Glimmering Imp gains advantage on {@skill Stealth} checks to remain hidden.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Illusory Distraction
entries: The Glimmering Imp creates an illusory duplicate of itself within 30 feet. This duplicate distracts enemies, granting advantage on the next attack made by the Glimmering Imp or an ally within 5 feet.

variant.name: Glimmering Imp Familiar

entries.name: Prerequisites
entries: The character must be a spellcaster with access to the {@spell Find Familiar} spell, or be a Warlock of the {@optfeature Pact of the Chain|PHB}.

As an alternative to the traditional familiars available through the {@spell Find Familiar} spell, a spellcaster may choose to bond with a Glimmering Imp as their familiar. The Glimmering Imp forms a unique and powerful partnership with its master, based on a magical and playful connection.

items: The Glimmering Imp familiar shares a telepathic link with its master, allowing communication over a distance of up to one mile and facilitating a deep understanding of each other's emotional states. It is able to understand and speak {@language Common} and {@language Sylvan}.
Once per day, the Glimmering Imp can craft a small illusion for 10 minutes to distract foes or amuse friends.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Gloomstalker makes two attacks: one with its claws and one with its Shadow Blade.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Shadow Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Shadowmeld
entries: As a bonus action, the Gloomstalker can merge into the shadows, becoming nearly {@condition invisible} until the start of its next turn. While merged, it has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks.

action.name: Terrifying Glare {@recharge 5}
entries: The Gloomstalker fixes its glowing eyes on a creature within 30 feet. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Goldenfire Bug's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the Goldenfire Bug is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

action.name: Dazzling Pulse
entries: The Goldenfire Bug emits rhythmic pulses of its radiant glow. Every creature within 10 ft. must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.name: Gravewing
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Echolocation
entries: The Gravewing can't use its {@sense blindsight} while {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The Gravewing has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The Gravewing doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Bone Shriek {@recharge 5}
entries: The Gravewing releases a piercing shriek. Each creature within a 20-foot radius must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of their next turn.

monster.name: Green Faefly Pip
languages: understands Sylvan but communicates via chirps

trait.name: Forest Camouflage
entries: The Green Faefly Pip has advantage on {@skill Stealth} checks made in wooded areas.

trait.name: Emotive Radiance
entries: When a Faefly Pip's hit points are reduced to half or below, its emotional luminescence triggers. Depending on its color:

entries.name: Green
entries: Their glow becomes a calming aura. Allies within 10 feet of the green Faefly Pip gain advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Tribal Agility
entries: The Graytail can take the {@action Disengage} or {@action Hide} action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Tail Attack
entries: The Graytail's tail is prehensile and can be used to make attacks or manipulate objects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Graytail makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its stick swing.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Stick Swing
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Tribal Shout {@recharge 5}
entries: The Graytail releases a loud, tribal shout. Every creature within 20 ft. of it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of their next turn.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Grottohush Mystic's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Bonded Companion
entries: The Grottohush Mystic and its {@creature mystic orb|MaM|orb} share a unique bond. If the orb is ever more than 60 ft. from the Mystic, both take 5 psychic damage at the start of their turns.

trait.name: Subterranean Camouflage
entries: The Grottohush Mystic has advantage on {@skill Stealth} checks made in cavernous or underground terrain.

action.name: Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Orb Gaze {@recharge 5}
entries: The {@creature mystic orb|MaM|orb companion} on the mystic's staff focuses its gaze on a creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by the Grottohush Mystic for 1 minute. The {@condition charmed} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Grottohush Sage is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). The Grottohush Sage has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: The Sage can see in dim light and darkness as if it were bright light.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Grottohush Sage makes two attacks: one with its claw and one with its staff.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Mystic Orb's Wrath {@recharge 5}
entries: The Sage commands its {@creature Mystic Orb|MaM} to release a burst of chilling energy. Each creature within a 20-ft. radius of the orb must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

action.name: Summon Mystic Orbs (1/Day)
entries: The Sage can summon {@dice 2d4} smaller {@creature Mystic Orb|MaM|Mystic Orbs} to aid it. These orbs are similar to the primary {@creature Mystic Orb|MaM} but have only 5 hit points each and lack the Distracting Glow action.

monster.name: Hollow Knight of Valor
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The Hollow Knight is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Hollow Knight has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Eternal Guardian
entries: The Hollow Knight is bound to protect a specific location, item, or person. It knows if that object is being threatened and can find the shortest path to it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Hollow Knight makes two lance attacks.

action.name: Lance
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d4 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Guardian's Move
entries: The Hollow Knight moves up to its speed without provoking {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks}.

legendary.name: Impale (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Hollow Knight makes a lance attack. If the attack hits, the target must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or take an additional 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Fire Manipulation
entries: The Ignisling can create small flames, ignite flammable objects, or extinguish minor fires within 10 feet of it as a bonus action.

action.name: Ember Spark
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) fire damage.

variant.name: Ignisling Familiar

entries.name: Prerequisites
entries: {@optfeature Pact of the Chain|PHB} (Warlock) or the {@spell Find Familiar} spell.

As a player character with the {@optfeature Pact of the Chain|PHB} feature or a spellcaster capable of casting the {@spell Find Familiar} spell, you have the option to choose an Ignisling as your familiar. To do so, you must first find and bond with an Ignisling, which typically involves befriending one in its natural habitat or summoning it from the Elemental Plane of Fire through a ritual.

items: The Ignisling familiar follows the standard rules for familiars or the {@optfeature Pact of the Chain|PHB} feature. It shares a telepathic bond with its master and can deliver touch spells on behalf of its master.
While summoned as a familiar, the Ignisling assumes its tiny, fire-themed humanoid form.
The Ignisling familiar can be summoned and dismissed using the {@spell Find Familiar} spell, and it can be returned to its native plane if it is ever killed or banished.

If the character has the {@optfeature Pact of the Chain|PHB} feature, the Ignisling familiar benefits from all the features granted by the {@optfeature Pact of the Chain|PHB}, including the ability to attack with its "Ember Spark" ability as described in the previous entry.

action.name: Ethereal Strike:
entries: {@homebrew  {@atk ms}} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) force damage.

action.name: Blessing of the Ancients
entries: The Kamiyo Spirit blesses one creature it can see within 60 ft. For the next minute, that creature gains a +2 bonus to AC, attack rolls, and saving throws.

action.name: Curse of Disrespect
entries: The Kamiyo Spirit targets one creature it can see within 60 ft. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be cursed. While cursed, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws. The curse lasts until removed by a {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The Kamiyo Spirit moves up to half its speed without provoking {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks}.

legendary.name: Ethereal Strike
entries: The Kamiyo Spirit makes one ethereal strike attack.

legendary.name: Healing Radiance (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Kamiyo Spirit emits a radiant glow, healing itself or one creature it can see within 30 ft. for 14 ({@dice 2d8 + 5}) hit points.

trait.name: Meditative Focus
entries: The Kenshiroku can enter a state of deep meditation as a bonus action, granting it advantage on Intelligence and Charisma saving throws for the next minute. Once used, this ability can't be used again until the Kenshiroku completes a long rest.

trait.name: Sword Mastery
entries: When the Kenshiroku hits with its katana, it deals an extra 4 ({@damage 1d8}) damage (included in the attacks).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Kenshiroku makes three katana attacks.

action.name: Katana
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@dice 1d8 + 4} plus {@dice 1d8}) slashing damage.

action.name: Mystical Gaze
entries: One creature the Kenshiroku can see within 30 feet of it must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target is {@condition paralyzed} until the start of the Kenshiroku's next turn. On a successful save, the target is not affected. The target is immune to the Kenshiroku's Mystical Gaze for the next 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the effect ends.

monster.name: Leonar the Lionhearted
alias: Leonar the Lionhearted, Warlord of the Roaring Skies

trait.name: Special Ability: King's Wrath
entries: Once per long rest, when Leonar the Lionhearted's health drops below 50%, his resolve strengthens, and he taps into his inner reservoir of power. For the next minute, Leonar gains the following benefits:

items.name: Regal Endurance:
entries: Leonar gains temporary hit points equal to half his maximum hit points. These temporary hit points persist until the end of the minute or until depleted.

items.name: Divine Retribution:
entries: Leonar's Lionheart Strike attacks now deal an additional {@damage 2d12} radiant damage, representing the divine energy channeled through his strikes.

items.name: Indomitable Roar:
entries: Leonar's Majestic Roar now affects all creatures within a 120-foot radius, and creatures who fail the saving throw are {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

During this powerful transformation, Leonar's aura of authority and presence is intensified, and he {@b gains advantage on Charisma-based checks and saving throws}. His lion-like mane glows with a radiant aura, and he emanates an aura of inspiration that bolsters the courage and determination of his allies.

action.name: Blazing Greatsword
entries: Leonar swings his massive greatsword of fire with extraordinary force, making three melee attacks, in a single action. Each attack has a {@hit 12} to hit and can target one enemy within a reach of 10 ft. Leonar can choose to focus all attacks on a single opponent or divide them among multiple enemies within range. Each successful strike deals 36 ({@damage 4d12 + 10}) slashing damage, along with an additional 11 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage.

action.name: Majestic Roar {@recharge 5}
entries: Leonar lets out a tremendous roar that affects all creatures within a 60-foot radius. Each creature must make a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

legendary.name: Majestic Roar (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Leonar uses his Majestic Roar ability.

legendary.name: Lionhearted Charge
entries: Leonar moves up to his speed in a straight line. During this movement, he can make one Blazing Greatsword attack against each creature he passes within reach.

legendary.name: Commanding Presence (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Leonar rallies his troops and commands them to fight with renewed vigor. All friendly creatures within 60 feet of him gain advantage on their next attack roll or saving throw.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
