headerEntries: The Lumeflare Necroshaman is a 12th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). The Lumeflare Necroshaman has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Flame-Scorched Skull
entries: Lumeflare Necroshaman's skull is constantly ablaze with ethereal blue and lilac flames. These flames shed dim light in a 20-foot radius and can not be extinguished. Any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the Necroshaman takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage from the flames.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Necroshaman Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Lupercorn Battlemage is a 12th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Lupercorn Battlemage has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Warrior's Instinct
entries: The Lupercorn Battlemage has advantage on Initiative rolls.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Lupercorn Battlemage makes two melee attacks with its lances or two spell attacks.

action.name: Lance
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

legendary.name: Lance Attack
entries: The Lupercorn Battlemage makes a lance attack.

legendary.name: Teleport (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Lupercorn Battlemage magically teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 60 feet.

legendary.name: Counterstrike (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: When a spell is cast within 60 feet of the Lupercorn Battlemage that targets it or includes it in its area of effect, the Lupercorn Battlemage can use its reaction to make a lance attack against the spellcaster.

trait.name: Shadow Step
entries: Once per turn, when in dim light or darkness, the Lurkspur can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see that is also in dim light or darkness. It then has advantage on the first melee attack it makes before the end of the turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Lurkspur makes two shortsword attacks or two dagger attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Evasion
entries: If the Lurkspur is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the {@homebrew Lurkspur|Felinshade} instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

action.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The Lurkspur deals an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the Lurkspur that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the Lurkspur doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Molten Core
entries: If the Magma Titan takes more than 40 damage in a single turn, it erupts, dealing 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage to all creatures within 10 ft. of it at the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Fiery Presence
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 5 ft. of the Magma Titan takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage.

trait.name: Heart of the Volcano
entries: Every time the Magma Titan is reduced to a quarter of its total hit points (25%, 50%, 75%), the elemental energies within it surge, triggering a volcanic reaction. The ground shakes, and geysers of molten lava spew out in random directions within a 40 ft. radius from the Magma Titan. Each creature in the affected area must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, they take 22 ({@damage 4d10}) fire damage and are covered in molten residue, taking an additional 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of their turns for the next 3 turns. On a successful save, they take half damage and are not covered in the molten residue.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Magma Titan makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 4d8 + 9}) bludgeoning damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Lava Burst {@recharge 5}
entries: The Magma Titan hurls a ball of molten rock at a point it can see within 60 feet. Each creature in a 10-foot radius sphere centered on that point must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Summon Lava Flow
entries: The Magma Titan causes the ground in a 20-foot square it can see within 60 feet to become molten. That area becomes {@quickref difficult terrain||3}, and any creature that enters or starts its turn in that area takes 22 ({@damage 4d10}) fire damage. The area cools after 3 rounds.

trait.name: Mask of Mystery
entries: It is unknown whether the Magravis's face is a mask or its actual visage. It has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Feathered Cloak
entries: The Magravis can use its feathered cloak to deflect attacks. When targeted by a ranged attack, it can use its reaction to add +3 to its AC against that attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Magravis makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Mystic Peck
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Radiant Plumage {@recharge 5}
entries: The Magravis releases a burst of radiant energy from its feathers in a 20-foot radius. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Malgorth can make three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d10 + 7}) piercing damage plus 21 ({@damage 6d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) slashing damage plus 21 ({@damage 6d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Shadow Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 12} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}36 ({@damage 8d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Summon Shadows {@recharge 5}
entries: Malgorth summons two {@creature Shadow Wraith|MaM|Shadow Wraiths} {@homebrew |(see description below)} to aid in combat. These wraiths remain under its control for 1 minute or until Malgorth is {@condition incapacitated}.

legendary.name: Shadow Step
entries: Malgorth teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary.name: Terrifying Presence
entries: Malgorth releases an aura of terror in a 30-foot radius. Each creature of its choice within that area must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

legendary.name: Shadow Bolt (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Malgorth unleashes a powerful bolt of dark energy as a ranged spell attack, {@hit 12} to hit, targeting one creature within 120 feet. On a hit, the target takes 36 ({@damage 8d8}) necrotic damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Marinth is a 7th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). Marinth has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The Marinth can breathe air and water.

action.name: Aqua Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 8} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Water's Embrace {@recharge 5}
entries: Marinth summons a powerful wave that sweeps over creatures within a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw, taking {@damage 6d8} bludgeoning damage and being knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Miremold Shambler makes two attacks: one with its Corrosive Grasp and one with its Slam attack.

action.name: Corrosive Grasp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). Until the {@action grapple} ends, the target takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the Shambler's turns.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Mold Spores {@recharge 5}
entries: When the Miremold Shambler takes damage, it can release a cloud of toxic mold spores in a 15-foot radius centered on itself. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The Mudmaw can breathe both air and water.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Mudmaw makes two mud claw attacks.

action.name: Mud Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Mudslide {@recharge 5}
entries: The Mudmaw slams its arms into the ground, causing the wet terrain around it to liquefy. Every creature within a 10-foot radius of the Mudmaw must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and be covered in thick mud. A creature covered in this mud has its speed halved and cannot take reactions until the end of its next turn.

monster.name: Mushcap
languages: understands Sylvan and Druidic but can't speak

trait.name: Bioluminescence
entries: The Mushcap can emit a soft glow, illuminating a 10-foot radius around it. It can turn this glow on or off as a bonus action.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the Mushcap remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a common, small mushroom.

action.name: Spore Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Illuminate
entries: The Mushcap increases the intensity of its bioluminescence, causing creatures within a 15-foot radius to become dazzled and have disadvantage on their next attack roll or Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check. This effect lasts until the end of the Mushcap's next turn.

variant.name: Mushcap Familiar

entries.name: Prerequisites
entries: The character must be a spellcaster with access to the {@spell Find Familiar} spell and must have a close connection to fey, forests, or fungal magic. This familiar might be especially resonant for Druids, feytouched sorcerers, or warlocks with a fey patron.

As an alternative to traditional familiars, a character can choose to bond with a Mushcap. This unique familiar shares a mystical and empathic link with its chosen master, reflecting their shared connection to the fey and the forest.

items: They share an empathic link, allowing telepathic communication up to one mile and sensing each other's emotions and well-being.
The Mushcap familiar is bioluminescent, capable of illuminating dark spaces at the command of its master.

If threatened, the Mushcap can use its Spore Touch defensively to protect both itself and its master. However, it has an innate aversion to salt. Direct contact with salt imposes disadvantage on all of the Mushcap's ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws until the end of its next turn.

monster.name: Mystic Orb
languages: understands Infernal and Undercommon but can't speak

trait.name: Telepathic Bond
entries: The Mystic Orb can communicate telepathically with the {@creature Grottohush Mystic|MaM} it serves, as long as they are on the same plane of existence.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Distracting Glow {@recharge}
entries: The Mystic Orb emits a bright flash of light. Each creature within 15 feet of the orb and able to see the light must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of the orb's next turn.

trait.name: Starborn
entries: The Nebula Drifter has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Star Beam
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 8} to hit, range 90 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d10}) radiant damage.

action.name: Nebula Veil {@recharge 5}
entries: The Nebula Drifter envelops itself in a swirling veil of stardust, becoming ethereal until the start of its next turn. While ethereal, it can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. If it ends its turn inside an object, it is shunted to the nearest unoccupied space and takes force damage equal to twice the number of feet it is moved.

action.name: Starfall {@recharge 5}
entries: The Nebula Drifter channels the power of a falling star to target one creature it can see within 60 feet. The target must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 18({@dice 4d8}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Cosmic Call (1/Day)
entries: The Nebula Drifter selects up to three creatures it can see within 90 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be teleported to an unoccupied space of the Nebula Drifter's choice within 30 feet of it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Necroshade makes two attacks: one with its Life Drain and one with its Chilling Touch.

action.name: Life Drain
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The necroshade gains temporary hit points equal to the hit point reduction.

action.name: Chilling Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) cold damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Spectral Grasp {@recharge 5}
entries: The Necroshade conjures spectral hands that reach out from the ground in a 20-foot radius centered on a point it can see within 60 feet. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) necrotic damage and is {@condition restrained} until the end of the Necroshade's next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition restrained}.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Nemuralis spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The Nemuralis can breathe both air and water.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Nemuralis makes two tentacle attacks.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Toxic Gaze {@recharge 5}
entries: One creature that the Nemuralis can see within 30 feet must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} for 1 minute.

While {@condition charmed} in this way, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} and drawn toward the Nemuralis, moving its speed toward her each turn. If the {@condition charmed} target is within 5 feet of the Nemuralis at the start of its turn, the Nemuralis can use a bonus action to bite the creature, dealing 12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Ethereal Shift
entries: As a being partially tethered to the Ethereal Plane, the Nexaleye can momentarily shift in and out of reality. When the Nexaleye takes damage that would reduce its hit points to 0, it can choose to drop to 1 hit point instead and become ethereal until the start of its next turn. While ethereal, it can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. If it ends its turn inside an object, it takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) force damage. After using this ability, the Nexaleye can't use it again until it finishes a long rest.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Nexaleye makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tendril Grasp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}.

action.name: Eyes of the Abyss {@recharge 5}
entries: The Nexaleye's central eye emits a piercing gaze. One creature it can see within 60 feet must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} with fear until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Smoke Cloak
entries: The Nightflame Steed is constantly surrounded by a thick, black smoky aura. This smoke provides it with {@quickref cover|PHB|3|0|half-cover} against ranged attacks.

trait.name: Fire Body
entries: A creature that touches the Nightflame Steed or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

trait.name: Sure-Footed
entries: The Nightflame Steed has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it {@condition prone}.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Blaze Charge {@recharge 5}
entries: The Nightflame Steed moves up to its speed in a straight line. During this movement, it can move through other creatures without provoking {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks}. Any creature the Nightflame Steed moves through takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) fire damage and must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Orisar's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 19}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Orisar has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Telepathic Bond
entries: The Orisar can communicate telepathically with any creature it can see within 60 feet.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Orisar makes two magical melee attacks.

action.name: Magical Slam
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) force damage.

action.name: Elemental Wave {@recharge 5}
entries: The Orisar releases a burst of elemental energy in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 8d8}) damage of either cold or fire damage (Orisar's choice) on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

bonus.name: Elemental Transmutation
entries: As a bonus action, the Orisar can change its damage resistance from cold to fire or vice versa.

legendary.name: Mystic Shift (Costs 1 Action)
entries: The Orisar uses its {@spell Misty Step} spell to teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary.name: Quickened Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Orisar casts one of its at-will spells.

legendary.name: Reality Warp (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The Orisar bends time around a single creature it can see within 60 feet. That creature must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Phantasmal Aegislash makes two sword attacks.

action.name: Spectral Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) slashing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Phantom Force {@recharge 5}
entries: The Phantasmal Aegislash becomes {@condition invisible} and moves up to its speed without provoking {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks}. At the end of this movement, it can make one Spectral Sword attack with advantage. On a hit, this attack deals an additional 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage.

bonus.name: Ethereal Shift
entries: As a bonus action, the Phantasmal Aegislash can shift between its Blade Forme (offensive) and Shield Forme (defensive). In its Blade Forme, it gains a +2 bonus to attack rolls and its attacks deal an extra 4 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage. In its Shield Forme, it gains a +2 bonus to its AC.

trait.name: Duality of Elements
entries: At the start of each of its turns, the Pyroaqua Demon can decide to envelope itself in either its fiery or watery nature. If it chooses fire, all melee attacks deal an additional {@damage 1d6} fire damage. If it chooses water, it gains a +2 bonus to its AC.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Pyroaqua Demon makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage if using its fiery nature or the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}) if using its watery nature.

action.name: Fiery Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The Pyroaqua Demon exhales a burst of flames in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Water Jet {@recharge 5}
entries: The Pyroaqua Demon expels a forceful jet of water in a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw, being pushed back 20 feet on a failed save and taking 27 ({@damage 6d8}) bludgeoning damage, or half as much damage and not being pushed back on a successful save.

monster.name: Red Faefly Pip
languages: understands Sylvan but communicates via chirps

trait.name: Heat Sense
entries: The Red Faefly Pips can detect sources of heat within 60 ft. of it.

trait.name: Emotive Radiance
entries: When a Faefly Pip's hit points are reduced to half or below, its emotional luminescence triggers. Depending on its color:

entries.name: Red
entries: Their glow intensifies into a fiery radiance. Any creature within 5 feet of the red Faefly Pip at the end of its turn takes 1 fire damage from the intense heat.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Illuminating Feathers
entries: As a bonus action, the Rose- Tipped Sentinel can produce a protective, radiant light from its feathers. All allies within 10 feet of the Sentinel gain a +1 bonus to their AC until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Peck
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Guardian's Gaze
entries: The Rose-Tipped Sentinel focuses its gaze on one creature it can see within 30 feet. That creature must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or have disadvantage on attack rolls against targets other than the Sentinel until the end of its next turn.

variant.name: Rose-Tipped Sentinel Familiar

entries.name: Prerequisites
entries: The character must be a spellcaster with access to the {@spell Find Familiar} spell.

As an alternative to the traditional familiars available through the {@spell Find Familiar} spell, the character may choose to bond with a Rose-Tipped Sentinel as their familiar. The Rose-Tipped Sentinel shares a magical and empathic connection with its chosen master, forming a unique and protective partnership.

items: The Rose-Tipped Sentinel familiar is a beast, carrying with it an air of regal composure despite its small size. This owl, brings with it the ancient wisdom and keen observation of its kind.
They share an empathic link, allowing telepathic communication up to one mile and sensing each other's emotions and well-being.

Once per day, the master can meditate with the Rose-Tipped Sentinel for 10 minutes, gaining keen insight into their surroundings. This effectively grants them advantage on {@skill Perception} checks for an hour.

trait.name: Rubble Camouflage
entries: The mottled pattern of the Rubble Rat's fur grants it advantage on {@skill Stealth} checks when hiding in urban ruins or garbage.

trait.name: Scavenger
entries: Rubble Rats have an uncanny ability to find food. If an edible item (by rat standards) is hidden or overlooked in a location, a Rubble Rat has a good chance of finding it. They have advantage on {@skill Perception} checks related to finding food in urban environments.

trait.name: Tunnel Expert
entries: Due to their time spent burrowing through debris and cramped urban ruins, Rubble Rats can move through spaces as narrow as 4 inches in diameter without squeezing.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 0} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 piercing damage.

trait.name: Multistance
entries: The Scaleclaw Wyrm can shift between a quadrupedal and bipedal stance as a bonus action.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The Scaleclaw Wyrm has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Scaleclaw Wyrm makes two attacks: one with its claws and one with its tail.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rending Grasp {@recharge 5}
entries: The Scaleclaw Wyrm grabs onto a target within 5 ft. The target must make a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or become {@condition restrained} and take 15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Frost Circle
entries: The Swlkysnow's white forehead circle is a source of its magical power. It grants the Swlkysnow advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Coldborn
entries: The Swlkysnow is adapted to life in extreme cold. It's immune to the effects of {@hazard extreme cold|DMG} weather and can move through snow without suffering from {@quickref difficult terrain||3}.

action.name: Claw Attack
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Icy Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) cold damage.

action.name: Spirit Whisper {@recharge}
entries: The Swlkysnow calls upon the spirits of the mountain to guide it. It gains advantage on all ability checks and attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

bonus.name: Healing Chant
entries: The Swlkysnow performs a magical chant, healing itself or one creature it can see within 30 feet for 10 ({@dice 2d4 + 5}) hit points.

reaction.name: Chill Armor
entries: When hit by a melee attack, the Swlkysnow can cause the attacker to take 4 ({@damage 1d8}) cold damage.

trait.name: Aqua Veil
entries: Once per day, the Serenewater Serpent can create a protective shield of water around itself, granting a +2 bonus to its AC until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Purifying Waters
entries: As an action, the Serenewater Serpent can release a wave of purifying energy in a 30-foot cone. Any allied creatures within the area regain 10 ({@dice 2d6 + 3}) hit points, and any {@condition poisoned} or diseased conditions affecting them are cured.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Serenewater Serpent makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail slap.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail Slap
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons

action.name: Life Drain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

monster.name: Shadowling
languages: understands Common and Dark Speech but can't speak

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The {@homebrew Shadowling|Blaze Sprite} can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

action.name: Shadow Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or have its speed reduced by 10 feet until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Shadow Burst
entries: The Shadowling releases a burst of dark energy, targeting all creatures within a 10-foot radius. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 9 ({@dice 2d8}) dark and psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: Shadow Veil
entries: As a bonus action, the Shadowling melds with nearby shadows, becoming nearly {@condition invisible} and gaining advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks until the start of its next turn. It can also move through other creatures' spaces as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3} during this time.

trait.name: Flickering Light
entries: As a bonus action, the Sparkling Kokori can create a magical light that sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. This light can be extinguished or rekindled as a bonus action.

trait.name: Telekinetic Manipulation
entries: The Sparkling Kokori can use its telekinetic powers to manipulate objects within 30 feet of it that weigh no more than 10 pounds. It can move, lift, or manipulate these objects as if using an {@condition invisible} hand. It can use this ability to perform simple tasks, retrieve objects, or create minor illusions by manipulating nearby objects.

action.name: Sparkling Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) radiant damage.

action.name: Stardust Burst
entries: The Starweaver releases a burst of celestial energy in a 5-foot radius. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Guiding Light
entries: As a bonus action, the Starweaver can choose to provide the {@creature Arcanist|MaM} with guidance. For the next turn, the {@creature Arcanist|MaM} gains advantage on the next spell attack it makes.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Stoneshield Guardian has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Warhammer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

bonus.name: Guardian's Aura {@recharge 5}
entries: As a bonus action, the Stoneshield Guardian can emanate a protective aura in a 10-foot radius. Until the start of its next turn, it and friendly creatures in the area gain a +2 bonus to AC.

monster.name: Sylvanstag
languages: understands Common and Druidic but can't speak

trait.name: Spirit of the Forest
entries: The Sylvanstag can communicate with animals and plants in a mystical, empathic language. It has advantage on Charisma ({@skill Animal Handling}) and Wisdom ({@skill Nature}) checks when interacting with creatures of the forest.

action.name: Hoof Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 5d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Nature's Embrace
entries: The Sylvanstag calls upon the healing power of nature. It regains 20 hit points, and the area within 30 feet of it becomes lightly obscured by a gentle rain that lasts for 1 minute. During this time, any friendly creatures that start their turn within the area regain 3 ({@dice 1d6}) hit points.

action.name: Entangling Vines
entries: The Sylvanstag summons magical vines in a 20-foot square within 60 feet of it. Creatures in that area must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained}. A creature can use its action to make a {@dc 18} Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within reach on a success. The vines have an AC of 15 and 20 hit points. Dealing 10 slashing damage to the vines (AC 15) destroys them.

legendary.name: Call of the Forest
entries: The Sylvanstag releases a magical call that resonates with the spirits of the forest. All friendly creatures within 60 feet of the Sylvanstag gain advantage on their next attack roll or saving throw.

legendary.name: Nature's Blessing
entries: The Sylvanstag bestows a blessing of nature upon a friendly creature within 30 feet of it. The target creature regains 21 ({@dice 2d10 + 10}) hit points, and any ongoing poison effects on the creature are immediately cured.

legendary.name: Whirling Cyclone (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Sylvanstag summons a swirling cyclone of wind and leaves in a 30-foot radius centered on itself. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save, or half as much damage and not be knocked {@condition prone} on a successful one. The area becomes lightly obscured by swirling leaves until the end of the Sylvanstag's next turn.

variant.name: Sylvanstag Companion
entries: The Sylvanstag has the ability to form a mystical bond with a creature of great virtue and respect for nature. This bond is known as the Sylvan Companion. Once the bond is established, the creature gains the following benefits:

items.name: Fey Bond
entries: The creature becomes attuned to the Sylvanstag's presence, and both can sense each other's emotions and general well-being, regardless of distance.

items.name: Forest Stride
entries: The creature gains the ability to move through natural terrain without leaving a trace. They leave no tracks or signs of passage, and they cannot be tracked by non-magical means.

items.name: Nature's Aid
entries: Once per long rest, the creature can invoke the Sylvanstag's blessing to gain advantage on a Wisdom or Charisma saving throw against a spell or ability that affects the mind or emotions.

items.name: Beast Whisperer
entries: The creature gains the ability to communicate with beasts as if they share a common language. Beasts are more inclined to regard the creature as a friend rather than a threat.

items.name: Gift of the Forest
entries: The Sylvanstag grants the creature the ability to cast the {@spell Speak with Plants} spell at will, allowing them to communicate with vegetation and glean information about the natural surroundings.

The bond with the Sylvanstag is not to be taken lightly, as it requires the creature to uphold the values of harmony, respect, and protection of the natural world. In return for their loyalty and virtuous conduct, the creature gains the friendship and support of the Sylvanstag, allowing them to tap into the mystical powers of the forest and be a true champion of nature.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The {@homebrew Thornback Terrapod|Marinth} can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Angry Defense
entries: Whenever the Thornback Terrapod takes damage, it gains a temporary bonus to its AC equal to the amount of damage taken. This bonus lasts until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Leafy Camouflage
entries: When the Thornback Terrapod remains motionless among dense vegetation (like bushes or foliage), it has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in those surroundings.

trait.name: Fury Burst
entries: Once per day, as a reaction to being hit by an attack, the Thornback Terrapod can unleash a burst of fury, granting it advantage on its next melee attack roll. If the attack hits, it deals an additional 5 ({@damage 1d10}) slashing damage.

action.name: Thorny Slash
entries: The Thornback Terrapod makes a melee attack with its sharp claws. {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage. The target must also succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Obtaining the Companion
entries: The player character might obtain the Thornback Terrapod as a companion through a class feature, such as the "{@subclassFeature Ranger's Companion|Ranger|PHB|Beast Master|PHB|3|PHB|Animal Companion}" feature of the Beast Master Ranger subclass. Alternatively, the DM might design a special quest or scenario that allows the player character to form a bond with the Terrapod, granting them the creature's companionship and loyalty.

entries.name: Bond with the Player Character
entries: The Thornback Terrapod forms a deep bond with the player character. It becomes fiercely loyal and protective, always ready to come to the character's aid and fight alongside them in battles.

trait.name: Symbiotic Bond
entries: If the Thorncrest is perched on a {@creature Thundorax|MaM}, it cannot be targeted by attacks or spells unless the {@creature Thundorax|MaM} is {@condition incapacitated} or if the Thorncrest is forced to leave its perch through some means.

action.name: Peck
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Parasite Cleanse {@recharge 5}
entries: The Thorncrest can remove all parasites from a creature it touches. The touched creature gains 2 ({@dice 1d4}) temporary hit points and feels a sensation of relief, negating minor status ailments like being slowed or {@condition stunned}. This lasts until the end of the creature's next turn.

trait.name: Thick Hide
entries: The Thundorax has resistance to non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

trait.name: Stomp
entries: If the Thundorax moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the Thundorax moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail Swipe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the Timeless Goliath fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The Timeless Goliath is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Timeless Knowledge
entries: The Goliath has advantage on all Intelligence checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Timeless Goliath can use its Chrono Disruption, then it makes four Time Strike attacks or two Time Strike attacks and one Gravitational Pull attack.

action.name: Time Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}36 ({@damage 4d12 + 10}) force damage.

action.name: Gravitational Pull
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 19} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}The target is pulled up to 30 feet directly towards the Timeless Goliath and takes 23 ({@damage 3d8 + 10}) bludgeoning damage. If the target ends this movement adjacent to the Timeless Goliath, it takes an additional 16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Chrono Disruption {@recharge 4}
entries: The Timeless Goliath selects a point within 120 feet that it can see. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 55 ({@damage 10d10}) force damage and is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition stunned}.

legendary.name: Temporal Shift
entries: The Timeless Goliath teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary.name: Age/Youthen (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: One creature the Timeless Goliath can see within 60 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 24} Constitution saving throw or age {@dice 1d20} years or become younger by {@dice 1d20} years. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn, ending the effect on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the Timeless Goliath's Age/Youthen for the next 24 hours.

legendary.name: Time Strike (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The Timeless Goliath makes a Time Strike attack.

trait.name: Photosynthesis
entries: The Toadstalk Trio can absorb sunlight and moisture through their roots, replenishing their energy and allowing them to regenerate minor injuries over time. At the start of their turn, the Toadstalk Trio regains 2 hit points if they are exposed to natural sunlight or are in contact with moist soil or vegetation.

action.name: Spore Release
entries: The Toadstalk Trio releases a cloud of toxic spores in a 10-foot radius centered on itself. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute, taking ongoing poison damage of 2 ({@dice 1d4}) at the start of each of its turns. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Vine Lash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} until the start of the Toadstalk Trio's next turn.

action.name: Shadow Slash
entries: The Twilight Dread unleashes a devastating slash infused with dark energy. It makes one melee attack against a target within reach. On a hit, the target takes 38 ({@damage 6d10 + 5}) slashing damage and 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Despairing Gaze
entries: The Twilight Dread locks its crimson eyes onto a single creature within 60 feet. The target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. The {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

legendary.name: Shadowstep
entries: The Twilight Dread magically teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary.name: Illusory Assault
entries: The Twilight Dread creates illusory duplicates of itself within 30 feet. The duplicates last until the end of its next turn or until they are destroyed. The duplicates have the same AC and hit points as the Twilight Dread, and they move and mimic its actions. A creature that can see the Twilight Dread's true form can discern the duplicates from the real one with a successful {@dc 19} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check. If the Twilight Dread takes damage while duplicates are present, one duplicate is destroyed for every 10 damage taken.

legendary.name: Nightmarish Wail (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Twilight Dread releases a chilling and harrowing wail. Each creature within 60 feet that can hear the wail must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

trait.name: Shadow Blend
entries: In areas of dim light or darkness, the Umbral Serpenthorn has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks.

trait.name: Eclipse Veil
entries: Once per day, as an action, the Umbral Serpenthorn can shroud itself in an ethereal eclipse, granting it advantage on all attack rolls and causing its attacks to deal an additional 10 necrotic damage for 1 minute. After using this ability, the Umbral Serpenthorn can't use it again until it completes a long rest.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Umbral Serpenthorn makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d4 + 5}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest.

action.name: Shadowstep {@recharge 5}
entries: The Umbral Serpenthorn magically teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. It can then make one bite attack as a bonus action.

trait.name: Multi-terrain Movement
entries: The Valorspine Drake can move through {@quickref difficult terrain||3} made of thorns, brambles, or similar natural hazards without expending extra movement.

trait.name: Spike Regrowth
entries: At the start of its turn, the Valorspine Drake regrows any spikes it had previously shot, if any are missing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Valorspine Drake makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Spike Shot {@recharge 5}
entries: The Valorspine Drake shoots a thorny spike from its back at a target within 30 feet. {@atk rw} {@hit 1} to hit, one target. {@h}7 ({@dice 2d6} ) piercing damage and the target must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking 4 ({@damage 1d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Shadow Blend
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the Vargloom can use a bonus action to become {@condition invisible}, reappearing with its next attack or when it enters bright light.

trait.name: Plane Walker
entries: The Vargloom can traverse between the Feywild and the Material Plane as a bonus action.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Lunar Howl {@recharge 5}
entries: The Vargloom releases a serene and otherworldly howl that resonates with the energy of the night sky. This howl has a calming effect. Every allied creature within 60 feet that hears the howl is imbued with a gentle protective aura. For the next minute, they gain temporary hit points equal to half the Vargloom's current hit points and advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}. This ability does not affect creatures that intend harm towards the Vargloom.

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: The drake has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

trait.name: Poisonous Aura
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the Venombreaker Drake must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of their next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The drake makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Poison Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The drake exhales poisonous gas in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Moonlit Rejuvenation (1/Day)
entries: If the Verdant Sylph starts its turn under direct moonlight, it can heal itself for 12 ({@dice 2d8 + 3}) hit points and cleanse itself of any paralysis, {@condition poisoned}, or {@condition stunned} conditions.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Verdant Sylph makes two vine whip attacks.

action.name: Vine Whip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Blossoming Embrace
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the Verdant Sylph can't use its Blossoming Embrace on another target.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Veremyrith has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Fire Aura
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the Veremyrith takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage.

trait.name: Keen Senses
entries: The Veremyrith has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight or smell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Veremyrith makes three attacks: one with its bite, one with its claws, and one with its tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Infernal Roar {@recharge 5}
entries: The Veremyrith releases a roar infused with infernal energy. Each creature within a 20-foot radius must make a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A {@condition frightened} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Ancient Guardian
entries: Veridion gains advantage on all saving throws against spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Rocky Resilience
entries: Veridion's skin grants it resistance to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

trait.name: Mountain's Blessing
entries: The ancient magical city on Veridion's back confers protection to those within it, granting immunity to poison and advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Multiattack. Multiattack:
entries: Veridion makes three attacks: one with its Bite, two with its Claw, or it can use its Tail Swipe instead of two Claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}54 ({@damage 8d10 + 10}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}41 ({@damage 7d8 + 10}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail Swipe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target within a 180-degree arc. {@h}48 ({@damage 7d10 + 10}) bludgeoning damage. Veridion can target up to three creatures within range that are no more than 20 feet apart from each other.

legendary.name: Roar of the Earth (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Veridion lets out a tremendous roar that shakes the ground and empowers allies. All friendly creatures within 60 feet of Veridion gain advantage on their next attack rolls.

legendary.name: Terraquake (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Veridion brings its immense power to bear, causing a cataclysmic upheaval in the earth. Every creature within a 120-foot radius of Veridion must make a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 55 ({@damage 10d10}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the creature takes half the damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, the Crystalweaver knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Luminous Lure
entries: In dim light or darkness, the Crystalweaver can cause its body to pulse with an enchanting red light, forcing creatures within 20 ft. to make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} for 1 minute. Once a creature successfully saves or the effect ends for them, they cannot be affected again for 24 hours.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or take 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage.

action.name: Web {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one creature. {@h}The target is {@condition restrained} by webbing. As an action, the {@condition restrained} target can make a {@dc 12} Strength check, escaping the webbing upon success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; 5 hit points; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

action.name: Crystal Shard Volley (3/Day)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 40/80 ft., multiple targets (up to three creatures within 10 ft. of each other). {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or take an additional 5 ({@damage 2d4}) poison damage as the shard releases the spider's venom upon impact.

trait.name: Spore Release
entries: When the Vileshroom Lurker takes damage, it releases a cloud of spores in a 10-foot radius around itself. Creatures in the area must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of their next turn.

trait.name: Fungoid Regeneration
entries: The Vileshroom Lurker regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and is in a damp environment.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d10 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Rock Form
entries: The Vileshroom Lurker can use its action to lie down and blend in with the surrounding rocks and fungi. While in this form, it is indistinguishable from a normal rock, and any creature that attempts to detect it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

trait.name: Innate Curiosity
entries: The Violetspike Wayfarer has advantage on Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) and Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks made to inspect unknown objects or unfamiliar places.

action.name: Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Charm
entries: The Violetspike Wayfarer targets one creature it can see within 30 feet. If the target can see the Violetspike Wayfarer, the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by the Violetspike Wayfarer until the Violetspike's {@status concentration} ends (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). While {@condition charmed} in this way, the target regards the Violetspike Wayfarer as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Violetspike Wayfarer Elder has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Innate Curiosity
entries: The Violetspike Wayfarer Elder has advantage on Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) and Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks made to inspect unknown objects or unfamiliar places.

action.name: Staff of the Elders
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) radiant damage.

action.name: Charm
entries: The Violetspike Wayfarer Elder targets one creature it can see within 30 feet. If the target can see the Violetspike Wayfarer Elder, the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by the Wayfarer Elder for 1 minute. While {@condition charmed} in this way, the target regards the Violetspike Wayfarer Elder as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Elder's Command (1/Day)
entries: The Violetspike Wayfarer Elder can issue a magical command to a creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or follow the command on its next turn. The command is similar to the {@spell command} spell but doesn't require {@status concentration}.

trait.name: Electrical Absorption
entries: When the Volticore is subjected to lightning damage, it regains hit points equal to half the lightning damage dealt.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Volticore makes two attacks: one with its electrified claws and one with its Thunderstrike.

action.name: Electrified Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) lightning damage.

action.name: Thunderstrike
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d8 + 2}) lightning damage.

trait.name: Soul Drain
entries: Whenever Vorax reduces a creature to 0 hit points with its Devouring Bite, it regains 50 hit points gains temporary hit points equal to the creature's maximum hit points.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Vorax fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Vorax makes four attacks: one with its Devouring Bite and three with its Claw.

action.name: Devouring Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}39 ({@damage 6d10 + 6}) piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) acid damage. The target's soul is partially drained. The creature must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the acid damage taken. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 6d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Slime Eruption {@recharge 5}
entries: Vorax releases a surge of corrosive slime in a 30-foot radius centered on itself. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 55 ({@damage 10d10}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Windblade Slash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}31 ({@damage 6d8 + 4}) slashing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) force damage.

action.name: Gust Shield
entries: As a reaction, the Vortexblade can summon a protective gust of wind that grants it a +4 bonus to its AC against one incoming attack. This ability can be used once per round.

action.name: Whirlwind Strike {@recharge 5}
entries: The Vortexblade unleashes a powerful whirlwind in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or take 36 ({@damage 8d8}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save, or half as much damage and not be knocked {@condition prone} on a successful one.

bonus.name: Windstep
entries: As a bonus action, the Vortexblade can become one with the wind, allowing it to move with unparalleled speed and agility. Until the end of its turn, its movement speed is doubled, and it can move through the space of any creature or object that is Large or smaller. The Vortexblade can use this ability once per round.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The Vurlinx has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put it to sleep.

trait.name: Camouflage
entries: The Vurlinx has advantage on {@skill Stealth} checks it makes in forested terrain.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Horn Rush
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Leaf Shield
entries: When a creature the Vurlinx can see targets it with an attack, the Vurlinx can add 2 to its AC against that attack. After using this trait, the Vurlinx can't use it again until it completes a short or long rest.

trait.name: Ethereal Strike
entries: Once per turn, when the Whispertooth Prowler hits a target with its claw attack, it can channel some of its ethereal essence into the victim. The target must make a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Whispertooth Prowler makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

bonus.name: Shadow Step {@recharge 5}
entries: As a bonus action, the Whispertooth Prowler can enter a shadowy state, becoming incorporeal until the end of its turn. While in this state, it gains advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks and can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. It can use this ability once per round.

monster.name: Xenoclaw Colossus
languages: understands Deep Speech but can't speak

trait.name: Ambush Predator
entries: The Xenoclaw Colossus has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

trait.name: Camouflaged Carapace
entries: While in swampy or wet terrains, the Xenoclaw Colossus has advantage on {@skill Stealth} checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Xenoclaw Colossus makes two claw attacks and one tail whip.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}36 ({@damage 5d10 + 9}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail Whip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d8 + 9}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Swift Retreat
entries: The Xenoclaw Colossus moves up to half its speed without provoking {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks}.

legendary.name: Powerful Snap
entries: The Xenoclaw Colossus makes a claw attack against a target within reach.

legendary.name: Submerge (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: If the Xenoclaw Colossus is within a water source, it can submerge itself. While submerged, it is considered to be under the effects of total cover. It can remain submerged for up to 10 minutes, after which it must come to the surface to breathe.

legendary.name: Earthen Slam (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The Xenoclaw Colossus uses its tail to strike the ground, causing a minor tremor. All creatures within a 20-foot radius must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and take 16 ({@damage 2d6 + 9}) bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: Zombspider Hand
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

action.name: Multi-fingered Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be {@condition grappled}.

action.name: Eyesight Beam
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) radiant damage.

reaction.name: Eye Shield
entries: When a spell or other harmful effect targets the Zombspider Hand, the central eye emits a burst of light. The Zombspider Hand has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects until the start of its next turn.

monster.name: Zombspider Hand Monstrosity
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

action.name: Crushing Fingers
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be {@condition grappled}.

action.name: Eyesight Beam {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 50 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 5d8}) radiant damage.

reaction.name: Eye Shield
entries: When a spell or other harmful effect targets the Zombspider Hand Monstrosity, the central eye emits a powerful burst of light. The Zombspider Hand has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects until the start of its next turn.

legendary.name: Lurch
entries: The Zombspider Hand Monstrosity moves up to its speed.

legendary.name: Tighten Grasp
entries: If a creature is currently {@condition grappled} by the Zombspider Hand Monstrosity, it takes 11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Ethereal Movement
entries: The Zynthriel can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Mind Shield
entries: Immune to being {@condition frightened} and has resistance to psychic damage.

trait.name: Psychic Channeling
entries: The tattoos on the Zynthriel's body are conduits for their psychic energy. They have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Zynthriel makes two attacks: one with its Psychic Burst and one with its tail.

action.name: Psychic Burst
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 6} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d8}) psychic damage.

action.name: Tail Swipe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Telekinetic Push {@recharge 5}
entries: One creature within 60 feet that the Zynthriel can see must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be pushed 20 feet away and knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The Zytort can breathe both air and water.

trait.name: Shell Defense
entries: The Zytort can retract its limbs and head into its shell as an action. While in this state, it gains a +4 bonus to AC, but it can't move or take actions until it emerges, which takes another action.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d10 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Quick Reflexes
entries: When a creature the Zytort can see attacks it, it can use its reaction to add 2 to its AC against that attack.

monsterFluff.name: Abyssal Courtier
entries: An amalgamation of elegance and terror, the {@b Abyssal Courtier} has the upper body of a graceful human with elongated, pointed ears and long, slender arms ending in razor-sharp claws. Their lower half, however, is a stark contrast, formed by writhing tentacles reminiscent of a deep-sea cephalopod. A lustrous cascade of long hair frames their face, which bears an expression of noble indifference. Clad in fine, aristocratic attire that somehow never seems to get wet, their entire form is cloaked in a hue of blue.

entries.name: Behaviour:
entries: The Abyssal Courtier is a creature of great intelligence and pride. They often play a role as diplomats or emissaries in underwater societies, negotiating deals with creatures of the deep. With their persuasive nature, they can be charming but are always looking for an upper hand.

entries.name: Habitat:
entries: These creatures reside in the deep, forgotten cities of the ocean floor, in grand palaces where pressure and darkness rule. Their homes are as majestic as they are eerie.

entries.name: Peculiarity:
entries: Diet consists mainly of deep-sea fish, but they are known to dine on any unfortunate land dwellers that sink into their domain. They are connoisseurs of ancient underwater artifacts, collecting and cherishing them.

monsterFluff.name: Aequorin
entries: The {@b Aequorin} is a small, charming worm-like creature. It possesses large, expressive eyes that contrast its simple, white, water-dripping body. Atop its head sits a grandiose three-pointed hat made of a watery substance, adorned with a blue gem and intricate silver patterns. A similarly adorned piece of armor encircles its neck, giving a semblance of regality to this humble creature.

entries.name: Behaviour:
entries: Aequorins are peaceful by nature but can be surprisingly resourceful in defending themselves. With their ability to speak both {@language Common} and {@language Primordial|PHB|Aquan}, they're known to interact with other creatures, often sharing stories of their underwater adventures and the mysteries of the deep. Their voice is melodious, akin to the gentle flow of a babbling brook.

entries.name: Habitat:
entries: Favoring damp and watery environments, these creatures often inhabit the banks of serene lakes, quiet ponds, or along gentle river bends. They can sometimes be found in damp caves or near springs.

entries.name: Peculiarity:
entries: The Aequorin's watery hat and armor aren't just for show. Legends speak of these unique elements being tied to the Aequorin's life force. The gems adorning its hat and armor are said to store elemental magic, and many believe that possessing one could grant its owner control over certain water-based abilities. However, separating a Aequorin from its gem could have dire consequences.

Aequorins have a unique life cycle intimately tied to lunar phases. Every full moon, they gather at specific, ancient locations known as "Moon Wells." These Wells are not water sources but rather mystical, shimmering pools of moonlight that appear only on such nights.

During this ritual, Aequorins engage in a mesmerizing dance around these Wells, absorbing lunar energy. It is believed that this ritualistic dance replenishes their watery essence, keeping them vibrant and alive. The shimmering dance of the Aequorins is a spectacle many adventurers have sought to witness, but the locations of Moon Wells are closely guarded secrets.

Another tradition involves their adornments. The silver armor and blue gems they wear are not just for protection or aesthetics. Each gem is handed down through Aequorin generations and is said to contain a fragment of an ancestor's essence. The Aequorins believe that wearing these gems keeps them connected to their lineage and provides guidance in life.

monsterFluff.name: Aetherdrake
entries: The {@b Aetherdrake}, at first glance, appears deceptively ethereal with its unique blend of pink and turquoise hues. However, closer inspection reveals a dragon of a darker intent. Its skin, though scaleless, is matte and almost leathery to the touch, casting unsettling shadows even in bright light. Tufts of feathers sprout from its forelimbs, and its tail ends in a twisted ball of matted feathers. Rather than the menacing horns one would expect, the Aetherdrake possesses long antennae that sway with the breeze. Reminiscent of a manticore, its form emanates an aura of malevolence and impending doom.

entries.name: Behaviour:
entries: While still wise and contemplative, the Aetherdrake uses its intelligence for more sinister purposes. Manipulative and cunning, they prefer to use their vast knowledge to bend others to their will. Their melodic roars often serve as deceptive lures or eerie warnings in the still of the night.

entries.name: Habitat:
entries: Dwelling in the hidden crevices of dark valleys or atop storm-ridden mountain peaks, these dragons surround themselves with an environment that matches their dark inclinations.

entries.name: Peculiarity:
entries: Drawn to obsidian and other dark, reflective stones, Aetherdrakes often line their lairs with these ominous gems, which are said to amplify their malevolent energies. Whispers among villagers speak of a curse befalling those who dare gaze upon an Aetherdrake during a lunar eclipse.

monsterFluff.name: Aquashade
entries: {@b Aquashade} is a mystical creature that combines the grace of water and the ethereal nature of shadows. It takes the form of a slender, serpentine body covered in iridescent scales that shimmer with hues of deep blues, purples, and silvers. Its long, sinuous tail undulates in the air, resembling flowing water. Aquashade has a sleek, streamlined head with large eyes.

entries.name: Behaviour:
entries: Aquashades are elusive and mysterious beings that inhabit secluded bodies of water, such as serene lakes, hidden waterfalls, or mystical springs. They are known for their tranquil and serene nature, often seen gliding through the water with an almost meditative grace. Aquashades possess an otherworldly aura, radiating a sense of calm and tranquility to those who encounter them. They are protectors of water and guardians of aquatic ecosystems, ensuring the balance and harmony of their domains.

entries.name: Habitat:
entries: Aquashades are most commonly found in serene and untouched aquatic environments. They are drawn to places where the natural flow of water is pure and untouched by pollution or disruption. These mystical creatures are rarely seen in populated areas, preferring the solitude and tranquility of secluded water bodies.

entries.name: Peculiarity:
entries: Aquashades possess the ability to manipulate water and shadows, seamlessly blending the two elements. They can create illusions and visions using water reflections, concealing their true form and confusing their adversaries.

monsterFluff.name: Arcanist
entries: The {@b Arcanist} is an enigmatic and captivating humanoid creature standing tall at around six feet. It possesses an elegant and slender build, with graceful movements that exude a sense of mystique. Its skin has a subtle iridescent quality, shimmering with hints of ethereal hues. Its long, flowing hair resembles cascading waves, seemingly alive with magical energy.

The Arcanist adorns itself in intricately embroidered robes made of delicate, shimmering fabric that mimics the night sky. The robes seem to blend seamlessly with the surrounding darkness, evoking a celestial aura. Adornments of arcane symbols and celestial motifs embellish the attire, hinting at the creature's deep connection with magic and cosmic forces.

entries.name: Behaviour:
entries: Arcanists are highly attuned to the arcane arts and possess an insatiable thirst for knowledge and understanding. Though reserved by nature, they are not reclusive and are known to willingly share their wisdom with those who approach them with genuine curiosity and respect. Arcanists have a deep respect for the balance of magic and seek to preserve the delicate equilibrium between arcane forces and the natural world.

entries.name: Habitat:
entries: Arcanists are typically found in remote and secluded locations, away from bustling civilizations. They are drawn to places where the veil between the mortal realm and the mystical realm is thin. Ancient temples, mystical groves, or the highest peaks of mountains are some of the places where Arcanists are known to reside. Their habitats are often surrounded by an aura of ancient magic, which they tap into for their studies and rituals.

entries.name: Peculiarity:
entries: Arcanists possess a profound understanding of arcane magic and have the ability to manipulate and harness various elemental forces. They can channel and shape the raw energy of fire, water, earth, and air, manifesting as powerful spells and elemental attacks. Additionally, Arcanists have an innate connection to celestial bodies and can draw upon the power of the stars and moon to enhance their magic, granting them heightened spellcasting abilities during celestial alignments. unoccupied space it can see that is also in dim light or darkness.
The arcanists are usually accompanied by the {@creature Starweaver|MaM|Starweavers}, they are their protectors and helpers.

monsterFluff.name: Azure Hornbeast
entries: The {@b Azure Hornbeast} stands at about 5 feet tall at the shoulder. Its strong body is covered with blue, feather-like scales that shimmer in the light, enhancing its intimidating presence. Two large, curved horns protrude from its head, and its muscular tail stretches to nearly the length of its body. Its legs are sturdy and strong, each ending in a set of sharp, formidable claws.

entries.name: Behaviour:
entries: Azure Hornbeasts are naturally solitary creatures, primarily active during the dawn and dusk. They can be quite territorial and are known to aggressively defend their chosen domains against intruders. Despite their fearsome appearance, they only attack if they perceive a threat to their territory or themselves.

entries.name: Habitat:
entries: Azure Hornbeasts can be found in a variety of environments, from dense forests to rocky hillsides. However, they are particularly fond of areas near water bodies, such as rivers or lakes, as their unique scales are designed to absorb moisture and keep them cool.

entries.name: Peculiarity:
entries: Azure Hornbeasts have a curious affinity for certain types of fruits, particularly a unique fruit called the Starberry. This purple, starshaped berry grows on climbing shrubs near water bodies and blooms during twilight hours, matching the Hornbeast's active period. The fruit's sweet scent can be detected from afar by the Hornbeast, which uses its horns to access the berries. Starberries, while being the beast's preferred food for their calming effects and high nutritional value, are not its sole diet; the Hornbeast can also eat other fruits and vegetation if necessary.

monsterFluff.name: Beetlestone Bot
